intro: Blepharis involucrata, commonly known as the desert eveningstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are often white or pale blue, blooming in the late afternoon or evening. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry conditions. The species is well-suited for xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
